The ruling Tuesday by the Board of Standards and Appeals clears a major hurdle for the developer, Louis V. Greco Jr. Mr. Greco said he would proceed with plans
title: Sliver Ruling Backs Developer of a Tower

body: Some residents of Brooklyn Heights are locked in a heated fight with a developer over a proposed 26-story condominium project that they say would ruin the character of their community of brownstones, churches and other low buildings. The controversy involves a narrow tower planned for a vacant plot at 67 Livingston Street, between Clinton and Court
title: PLAN FOR NARROW TOWER FOUGHT IN BROOKLYN HEIGHTS

body: Hyman M. Cleon, former senior civil engineer in the office of the Brooklyn borough president, died Dec. 27 at his home in Bay Harbor Islands, Fla. He was 88 years old. Mr. Cleon joined the borough's engineering staff in 1922 and was among those responsible for the concept of the three-tier design for the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway and the Promenade
title: Hyman M. Cleon Dies at 88; Ex-Civil Engineer in Brooklyn
